meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel troubled, worried, or concerned.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise bothered me during the test.
meanings.sent2: She bothered to check on her sick friend every day.
meanings.sent3: The cat bothered to chase its tail in circles.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds bothered the sky, hinting at a storm.
meanings.sent5: The persistent mosquito bothered me all night, buzzing in my ear.

meanings.definition: To take the time and trouble to do something.
meanings.sent1: He bothered to fix the leaky faucet in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: She never bothered to reply to his messages.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel bothered to gather nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The artist bothered to paint every detail of the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The teacher bothered to explain the lesson in a simple way.
